alert.note: Alert for Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 6:25PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Yavapai County through 700 PM MST... At 624 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Dewey-humboldt, or 9 miles east of Prescott Valley. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds of up to 45 mph, heavy rainfall, and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Prescott Valley, Dewey-humboldt, Yavapai County Fairgrounds, Prescott Airport, Prescott Valley Event Center, Mingus Mountain Campground, Playground Group Campground and Potato Patch Campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 89 between mile markers 316 and 321. State Route 89A between mile markers 318 and 344, and near mile marker 346. State Route 69 between mile markers 277 and 292. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be alert for warnings.
